text: is the name of a Japanese artificial satellite which was put into orbit. The launch was a project of the Institute of Space and Astronautical Science of the University of Tokyo. Tenma was sent into orbit on February 20, 1983.JAXA, "Catalogue of ISAS Missions" ; retrieved 2012-4-16. This was Japan's second x-ray astronomy satellite. == References== == Other websites == * Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA), Tenma (ASTRO-B) mission profile * NASA, Tenma (astro B) satellite Category:Japanese satellites Category:1980s in spaceflight
title: Tenma
